sentence.text: Fat mass and obesity-associated protein (DNA dealkylation involved in DNA repair) single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) have been linked to increased body mass and obesity in humans by genome-wide association studies (GWAS) since 2007.

entity.text: DNA dealkylation involved in DNA repair

sentence.text: Although some recent studies suggest that the obesity-related SNPs in DNA dealkylation involved in DNA repair influence obesity susceptibility likely through altering the expression of the adjacent genes such as energy homeostasis and negative regulation of G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway, rather than FTO itself, a solid link between the SNP risk genotype and the increased FTO expression in both human blood cells and fibroblasts has been reported.

entity.text: DNA dealkylation involved in DNA repair
negative regulation of G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: Epidemiology studies also showed a strong association of DNA dealkylation involved in DNA repair SNPs and overweight/obesity with increased risk of various types of cancers.

entity.text: DNA dealkylation involved in DNA repair

sentence.text: As the first identified messenger RNA N6-methyladenosine (cellular response to DNA damage stimulus) demethylase, DNA dealkylation involved in DNA repair has been shown recently to play m6A-dependent roles in adipogenesis and tumorigenesis (especially in the development of leukemia and glioblastoma).

entity.text: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
DNA dealkylation involved in DNA repair

sentence.text: This mini review discusses the roles and underlying molecular mechanisms of DNA dealkylation involved in DNA repair in both obesity and cancers, and also summarizes recent advances in the development of FTO inhibitors

entity.text: DNA dealkylation involved in DNA repair
